Package jparsec.ephem.planets

Provides additional classes for ephemerides of planets, comets, and asteroids.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    EphemElement
    Convenient class for ephem data access.
    JPLEphemeris
    A class to perform ephemeris calculations using JPL numerical integration theories.
    Newcomb
    Applies Newcomb's solar theory, published in 1898.
    OrbitalElement
    An adequate class for storing orbital elements in the FK5 system.
    OrbitEphem
    Provides method for calculating ephemeris of planets, comets, and asteroids, using orbital elements, as well as for obtaining data of the orbital elements.
    PlanetEphem
    A class for planetary and lunar ephemeris calculations, based on a fit to JPL DE404 ephemeris over the interval 3000 B.D to 3000 A.D for giant planets, and 1500 B.D. to 3000 A.D. for inner planets (including Mars).
    PlanetEphem_data
    A class to hold static data by Moshier to obtain planetary ephemeris.
    PlanetEphem_data_libration
    A class to hold static data by Moshier to obtain planetary ephemeris.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    OrbitalElement.MAGNITUDE_MODEL
    The different magnitude models for comets and asteroids.

Package jparsec.ephem.planets Description

Provides additional classes for ephemerides of planets, comets, and asteroids.

This package contains planetary theories different from VSOP87A/D, SERIES96, and ELP2000. Moshier theory is a fit to JPL DE404 ephemeris. There are also different JPL ephemeris versions available. Newcomb is an implementation of Newcomb's old solar theory. OrbitEphem implements also the original VSOP87 solution using orbital elements, and allows the computation of ephemerides for minor bodies.
